str2: When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Four thousand. From the multiplicative adverb of tessares and chilioi; four times a thousand.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Genitive Feminine Plural
str2: How much, how great, how many. From an absolute pos and hos; interrogative pronoun how much (plural) many).
A plaited basket. From speiro; a hamper or lunch-receptacle.
A fragment, broken piece. From klao; a piece.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To raise, lift up, take away, remove.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
